p: Cinnamon plants ( Cinnamomum spp., Lauraceae) are woody species native to South and Southeast Asia, commonly used as food flavors and folk medicinal plants. Cinnamomum osmophloeum Kanehira has long been used as a medicinal plant. Natural products obtained from cinnamon plants display versatile bioactivities, including antibacterial, antifungal, antioxidant, and anxiolytic effects, etc. [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5].
